posts.name: Zeke
posts.cooked: My team has an auto align to the reef using our limelights, and we have our auto working, but when we change the PID to try to be faster in Autonomous,  it also changes it in TeleOp. We tried to reconfigure AutoBuilder, but it appears to not work. Has anybody tried this and had any success?

posts.name: Ethan Grieshop
posts.cooked: Where in your code are you setting your Teleop pid?

posts.name: Zeke
posts.cooked: In our drive.java (we’re using the Mechanical Advantage Talon Fx Template), we made a function called changePID which takes in our PID values we want to use, we do AutoBuilder.Configure() with our new PID values in that

posts.name: Ethan Grieshop
posts.cooked: When you set your pid values, enclose the statement in an if (DriverStation.isTeleoperated) { To make sure you’re only setting during Teleop. Since the drive method is called periodically in Auton and Teleop, you’ll want to differentiate this.

posts.name: Zeke
posts.cooked: We’ve tried this as well and not had any luck, are you able to switch PID ’s successfully? If so, are you using AutoBuilder?

posts.name: Ethan Grieshop
posts.cooked: Search for all references to your pid controller instance. See where it’s being edited, because something has to change.

posts.name: Eric (319)
posts.cooked:
When i hear change pid to make something faster it makes me a little worried…

From my (limited) understanding. I assume you want to tune a pid that controls your robot’s position / velocity. I’m not sure which is your desired setpoint off the top of my head ( as i haven’t looked at the new templates from 6328 )

My gut feeling ( with the potential of being wrong ) is to tell you that by changing the PID gains. That you’re modifying the transient response in such a way that you may be accelerating quicker. ( which is good) as long as you don’t go overboard.

While lowering the gains will slow down the robot’s accelleration. You still want to be able to be sure your robot’s drivetrain 'gets to where you want it to be in an appropriately fast manner"

So i’m going to stop rambling and ask. Have you tried using two different constraints for auto and tele instead?

https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html#pathfind-to-pose
